newsitem.title: LATVIA: C.BANK WORKS ON CONSOLIDATED SUPERVISION.
newsitem.headline: C.BANK WORKS ON CONSOLIDATED SUPERVISION.

text.p: The central Bank on Friday said it is working on law amendments to introduce consolidated supervision to ensure that all Basel principles are applied in Latvia.
"In order for the central bank to carry out consolidated supervision, amendments to the credit institution law are currently being worked on," the bank said in a statement.
The bank also said that some 80 percent of the Basel committee banking supervision principles have already been implemented in the country.
"Other principles, referring mainly to consolidated supervision, have to be implemented gradually, in line with the banking system's development," the central bank said.
Consolidated supervision concerns reports of credit institutions which have daughter credit institutions or financial companies, including ones abroad.
An important aspect of this supervision is the exchange of information between the countries, home to financial institutions of one group, the bank said.
